intro: Didymocarpus pteronema, commonly known as the winged mangosteen, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive winged fruits. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The fruit, which is edible, has a thick, leathery rind and a sweet, segmented pulp.
